title: Engagement Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews and it was a good experience. The first interview was a one-on-one and the second interview was with the entire team. I think they could have had a better job description of the role on the application and that is why I gave this role a neutral experience.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: It is the Standard questions that every interview has such as tell me about yourself, work experience, biggest challenge, and opportunities for improvement. They are usually in person and very easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Name one of your biggest strengths.

title: Dual Role Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: 7 people sat around the conference room table... all of them interview me simultaneously. I was given no warning about this and felt overwhelmed. Some of them were rude and asking questions that felt irrelevant.
Interview Questions: How would you handle working in the call center even though you applied to work directly with patients only.

title: Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed twice and everything went well. Had a VM from HR with a job offer and was then ghosted by the entire department. Was a rather traumatic experience. My texts and calls just went unanswered.
Interview Questions: Questions about leadership mostly really.

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions, took about an hour, it took about two weeks to get an offer. Once I got an offer there was a lot to complete but over all it’s been a moderate process
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for uc health ?

title: Advanced Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth (Loveland, CO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was streamlined. I received all the information I needed within a reasonable amount of time. I did the interview over video. Every person was very nice and timely.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you were under pressure, how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to two nurse managers and they took turns asking questions. Both managers were very nice and I was offered the positions a few hours later. You are given 3 days to decide and they send benefits and salary information documents.
Interview Questions: How to handle different patient scenarios

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Denver Metro Area, end of April/early May 2023. TLDR; experience was fine overall, but in the end, I was offered $20/hour. I tried to negotiate since the posted range was $19-$24, was told his "hands were tied," and I declined the offer. I first spoke with a recruiter over the phone. It was VERY standard, just asking about availability, schedule, etc. I asked questions about the role, expressed my skills and what I anticipated the role to be like. He was impressed and shared that he thought I'd do very well in the interview. I was scheduled for a virtual interview next. The interviewer was really nice, great experience. She went over what locations I could work in, any time off I might need, etc. Then she asked me a bunch of behavioral interview questions. Tell me about a time when... conflict with a coworker, dealing with a difficult customer, learning a new computer system, etc. There were 4-6 questions. She gave me an opportunity to ask questions and told me they'd be in touch shortly. Later that day I received an email request to submit 5 references into their online system. It sent them an online survey of some sort. That same day, I got a call from the recruiter offering me the job, pending references. I was offered $20/hour. I asked for three business days to think about it and to make sure my references had a chance to respond. I called a couple days later and tried to negotiate a higher wage. The posted range was $19-$24. The minimum required experience was "none." Preferred experience/skills was customer service, working independently, assisting patients check in, insurance verification, etc. I don't have a lot of formal healthcare experience, but I have 9+ years of customer service experience in a variety of roles, 4 years of HR experience, and 2 years tech industry experience. I also have a B.A. I was willing to take $23, maybe even $22, because I wanted to start a long-term career with UCHealth given the growth opportunities. I'm flexible with my schedule and with the location I travel to. I made my case to the recruiter and he said his "hands were tied." I politely declined, it's just not a sustainable wage in this area. Also, why post such a wage range if there really isn't a range? Just an FYI for people interviewing! Maybe ask about wage upfront!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when... you had a conflict with a coworker, you had to deal with a difficult customer a time when you had to learn a new computer system, etc. There were 4-6 questions behavioral interview questions.

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went great. Basic interview questions. I was called and given an offer (part-time) which was less than I make at my FT job, I counter-offered and was told they would call me back. I never heard back from the recruiter after multiple emails. I don't care if they moved on to other candidates, but they wasted my time with their poor communication.
Interview Questions: tell me about your experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough. It involved a phone conversation with the recruiter and 2 in person interviews. Everyone was polite and respectful. I felt very much at ease and was able to ask questions of them as well.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with conflict

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: 1 month after applying did an video questionnaire. 1 month after that got invited for a video interview 1 day later. It was a teams and 2 members of management interviewed me about 20 mins.
Interview Questions: How to handle a difficult situation.

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position and received an interview request pretty quickly. I think it took about a week. I was interviewed via Microsoft Teams by the IT Manager and the District IT Manager. They asked a few questions, the conversation flowed pretty well, they joked about my dog who was in the background, etc. Near the end, they said they would let me know within a week. It took 4-5 weeks to hear back from them and the "not selected" email was cold and impersonal.

title: Senior Marketing Research Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Phone and on-site interview. They're using the on-site to farm new ideas. Most of the team seem confused about what the job role entailed. A few hours after the on-site I received an email stating that they had selected another candidate.

title: RN Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a 45 min long interview that included one supervisor and two other managers. The supervisor and one of the managers were in person and the other manager interviewed me over TEAMS.

title: Business Manager Interview

The manager went on vacation for a month and I heard from her in the beginning of January and then I had to reach out 2 weeks later. I didn't get the job. It took over 2 months and the process was very long.

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: never called for interview. unable to get in touch with anyone to schedule it for two weeks. interview difficult because I had no outline of the interview process to go by.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: RN, Bsn Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was virtual due to Covid. It lasted about 45 minutes and there were several people on the call asking questions. I started by introducing myself and then they got into the job position.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience where you’ve had to prioritize.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Scheduling Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Before I was called to interview I had to send out a reference survey to 5 former colleagues. I was then contacted and had a 45 min interview. Then was ghosted, after already asking for references,
Interview Questions: Not many pertaining to the role mostly about my experience

title: Graduate Registered Nurse Interview

title: AHT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth

title: Psychiatrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was awkward with rapid fire questions and multiple people present. Then you tend to meet with people who align more with your interest. Those meetings were more layed back
Interview Questions: Behavioral situations about patient care and teamwork

title: Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited for a senior director role by an executive recruiter and then had several interviews with the supervisor and other team members over three months. I had to submit written assignments. I was identified as a strong candidate and finalist. Went to be interviewed on-site, traveling across the country; and it was downhill from there. On-site the decision-makers seemed more concerned with my recent job gap and decision to leave a toxic boss and position just short of a year, even though I had so much other experience and had been vetted significantly before being identified as a finalist. Leadership interviews were either superficial and impersonal or very granular. I felt like I got thrown under the bus. And the whole thing was disorganized- technology failing left and right, agenda for the day constantly changing, no warm welcome- I even got dropped off at the wrong hotel and they did not want to pay for my taxi back to the airport. I observed a lot of good and dedicated people but also saw the other side. For example, a top executive reprimanding my potential supervisor instead of greeting me as I waited to meet her, last minute questions about my resume with heavy scribbling in the margins as I fielded what should have been initial screening questions, and  lowball statements  like “why would you move here if you think where you live now is beautiful?” It was cat and mouse for sure, and I have several examples about how this played out. A lot of talk about brand and valuing the patient experience  but my recruitment experience was surprisingly poor. Red flags everywhere. My recruiter and the supervisor did not do their due diligence before I arrived or I would not have been answering basic questions about my last job or resume- it should have been higher level or just do not being me forward.  HR got involved post-interview knowing nothing and the people who knew better sandbagged me. I wish I had never interviewed at UCHealth. I took the brunt of their poor internal communication and was not respected or deemed worthy. After all my effort, I did not even get a phone call or any constructive feedback when they decided not to proceed with my candidacy. I received a perfunctory email. I was very disappointed the supervisor could not even give me the courtesy of a phone call. I thought that they cared about people but I must be the exception.  The guy I would have reported to looked exhausted but not sure where his head was. Guess I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Why did I leave my last job?

title: OR Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: A very straight forward process. Interview with recruiter followed by a panel interview with charge nurse and managers! Be ready to provide examples to scenarios.  Also know the mission behind UC Health.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled a stressful situation.

title: Medical Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: For a virtual interview,it was it was ran nice with their team there ready to ask and answer questions. They were informative  about the day to day tasks and job responsibilities.
Interview Questions: How I handle conflict in the work space

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: super great communication along the way. Long written application then I interviewed with the managers of my top three units plus some other managers for units that are related. Got first offers within 24 hours with all offers from the interview rolling out within 3-4 days. Very clear offer summarizing pay, next steps, and benefits.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse? What would you do if you were not a nurse? Why these units? Why UC health? Time you had a challenge? Time you made a difference in patient care? Best part of nurse and worst part for you?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview

The questions asked by the PT and OT were of average difficulty and afterwards, the PT and OT fielded any questions I had about the position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Very fast and straight to the point! Interviewing with multiple units at once can be hard because most people like to relate to each unit differently.  I apply to units for different reasons
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with a coworker and how you managed it

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview with the hiring manager that went well. She was informative, prepared, and pleasant. I never heard back from anyone following this discussion which was disappointing.
Interview Questions: Standard initial phone screen questions about my background and experience as it related to the position.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Charleston, SC) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Clear interview questions and process. Great communication and follow up from the beginning of the interview process through to the end. Provided direction for the day and expectations for who would be preset during the interview.
Interview Questions: If offered this position, tell me what may be one challenge you expect,

title: Pharmacy Intern Interview

For this position it should have been understood that I am a student and would have been in class; therefore, I think email should have been the primary form of communication (instead of randomly calling me while I was in class). I guess it worked out not to be called back to officially schedule an interview as it seems there is not much understanding for students.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview

The questions were pretty regular - "why do you want this job?"  "can you give an example of a time where you had to resolve a difficult situation with a co-worker or client?" 
I met with the clinic lead/manager on site and met the area manager via Microsoft Teams. Both asked questions.
Interview Questions:
"What do you do to take care of yourself?"
"Why do you want to work for UC Health?"
"What personality traits of yours would complement this role?"
"Can you give an example of resolving conflict with a co-worker?"
"How do you handle a situation where your co-worker doesn't communicate with you?"
"What are your strengths?"
"What are your weaknesses?"

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Process was simple. Submitted an application, attended a virtual hiring event/information session, scheduled an interview. 

Interview was done entirely remotely through Zoom. 

The interview panel were all very nice and I had a great time. I believe that I was not offered the position simply because they found someone with more experience than myself (I have 4+ years).
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience as a recruiter and the challenges you have faced during COVID-19.

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for a social media specialist role and took the time during my vacation to find the right setting and room for a video conference only to have it be a phone call that could have happened anywhere. Wasting my time on vacation started us off on the wrong foot. 

I had a great background, and we connected pretty well, but UC Health fetishizes paid Facebook ads even if finding success with organic is harder. (And I can tell they prefer paid Facebook posts because they need help on their boring organic copy. Yikes!) They wanted someone with a budget experience of $100k, and I only had several hundred to a few thousand campaign experience. What a ridiculous demand! 

What made matters worse was the rejection email claiming I was on "a great path for learning." I know that this response was well-intentioned, but I am a little too far along in my career to be "on a great path of learning." I ran the social for the nationwide brand for 4-plus years, and before that, I have 3 years in B2B. You write that if TikTok marketing were a requirement and not being picky with having enough paid experience (from a budget standpoint).
Interview Questions: What were examples of Facebook paid ad campaigns you managed?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application along with a quick video interview. They were very welcoming and  kind. I interviewed for the L&D unit. They were able to referr me to another department.
Interview Questions: What was a positive patient experience you have had?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: They were very thorough, responsive, and engaging.  I started with a phone interview and then I had an opportunity to shadow the workers in the office before a formal interview.  I have one more interview with staff that wasn’t  there during my first formal interview and hope to revive an offer.

Interview Descriptions: First, a phone interview and then a sit down with the manager. Was also able to meet with coworkers in an interview. There was time to ask questions and felt very positive.

Interview Descriptions: Thought I was only meeting with manager of unit, and was blind sided by two more people. One was quite unfriendly. After interview, I was asked if I was interested in a prn position, but I was interviewing for a full time position. Communication and follow up was poor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you resolved a patient conflict.

In one of the interviews, I had to speak Spanish, which I was not told ahead of time. They ended up hiring someone with more experience than me - although it was advertised as a part-time, entry level position.

title: Materials Analyst Interview

title: Rad Technologist Interview
