Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth, I am looking forward to working with this hospital. The hr are very efficient and keep in contact regarding the potential hiree. I am very excited.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Centralized Scheduling Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I received a call to be interviewed and they wanted to interview me the next day. I explained I worked 8:30 to 5 so was told to do the interview via Microsoft teams over my lunch break.  Because of this I had to interview on my phone out of my car. 
That evening around 6:45pm I received an email saying I had to have 5 coworkers complete a 30 question survey about me. 25 multiple choice, 5 written. Two had to be managers. This had to be completed within 24hours, participants had to complete within 72hrs. 
Interviewed via Microsoft Teams on the phone the day after initial call. Two people interviewed me at the same time. Their camera was set up facing a wall, not them so I was unable to see who I was communicating with.   Interview was scheduled for 30 minutes however lasted about 10-15. 
I was assured regardless if being offered the position or not, I would hear from them no later than the end of the following  week.  I never heard from them again.
Interview Questions:
How do you get to know coworkers? 
What makes you the best candidate for this potion?

title: Registered Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The first one was okay, it was zoom and there were 3 people present- nurse manager, a day charge and night charge. They were seated at a table with masks on so it didn't feel as personal or comfortable as it wold in person or if I could see their faces. Under current COVID circumstances it was understandable. They were very nice and answered my questions easily. 

My second interview was just with the manager over zoom but it was almost like 'facetime' with no mask and felt more personal. This interview felt more comfortable and the interaction was easy going. Very nice!
Interview Questions:
Q: where do you see yourself in 2-5 years? 

Q: Why UC Health, why Colorado, and why this unit? 

Q: What is your secret talent/hobby? 

Q: What are your expectations of me if I were your manager? 

Q: What would you do if you saw a peer doing something wrong or unethical? 

Q: what would you say is your greatest achievemnet professionally? 

Q: Give an example of a difficult situation at work and how did you deal with it?

title: New Nurse Graduate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with recruiter via email and phone to set up a Microsoft Teams virtual interview with the unit manager(s). The interview was relaxed and the managers explained the unit, my role, and then asked me questions. Then I was given the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews one phone one video with Microsoft team app!!!!!!!! Still in process will have second interview soon. Nothing else to say yet have not  finish second interview just here to do research
Interview Questions: What do you see your self in 10 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was done over the phone via skype. I interviewed with the manager and the assistant manager. It was a formal process but comfortable experience. Although I didn't get to tour the unit when it came to the orientation they were very helpful with the details.
Interview Questions: Describe a time a didn't get along with someone.

title: Administrative Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and one Skype interview. Tell us about yourself and other behavioral questions. Each interview was about an hour long process. Make sure you know your information about the organization and what you want to learn. They want operational and analytical individuals on their team.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions and one case study

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: They communicated well throughout the whole process and are very direct. It was difficult doing everything virtual but is understandable given the circumstances. It is very competitive so come prepared with your interview answers!
Interview Questions: Why this hospital? Why this unit?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It consisted of a panel of 3 interviewers. They were all very welcoming. The interview consisted of common questions. A couple dealing with how you deal with conflict, and how you receive/ give feedback.
Interview Questions:
-An example of a conflict, and how you came to an agreement?
- Name a time where you were given feedback. How do you react to feedback?

title: Manager Security Investigations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about two months after I applied. The first interview was with the hiring manager (security director), second interview was a panel interview with the security team, the third interview was with random hospital directors within the UCHealth System, and the final interview was with the security director again. The entire process felt like they were making it up as they went, honestly. The security director was kept looking at his clock during my 4th interview and was very short. I found it quite rude. Not surprisingly, I didn't get the job and they wasted a lot of my time.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take if an employee was threatened and had a restraining order on someone?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good. Staff made me feel comfortable- I was initially nervous but they did a good job of not making it so intimidating.  Questions were general and nothing too crazy.
Interview Questions: General questions about myself and how I would act in certain situations

title: Fitness Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions:
Started by giving a tour of the facility. 

Group interview, simple questions, some questions were situational, many questions were customer service based questions. Have examples ready and how you would have done better.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you provided excellent customer service

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: You have a set video time of not of your choosing. You will interview with the manager and assistant manager as well as the educator and possibly charge nurses. It will last about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: If you could choose a different career other than nursing what would it be.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were no in person interview due to COVID-19 so all interviews took place via Microsoft Teams.  I interviewed with 3 people from the hiring unit.  They were all really nice.
Interview Questions: If you didn't chose nursing, what career would you have?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Panel of people asked me questions about why I wanted to work for UCHealth, why they should hire me, what are my strengths and weaknesses, how do I handle stress/rude comments
Interview Questions: If you could do anything other than nursing what would you do and why?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I received an email to setup a phone interview with the manager of the unit.  The interview was very relaxed and consisted of typical questions that you would get with any other interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: I first spoke to someone briefly before scheduling the interview. The person spoke to made me feel excited to possibly work for the team. During the interview I felt welcomed and the flow was very easy going, but still professional.
Interview Questions: What was prior work experience I had?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview. Customer service oriented and patient centered. Around 30 minutes in the interview. Be there ON time, or you will miss the opportunity. Good luck and please dress appropriately. Regular questions - nothing out of the norm. Regular questions - nothing out of the norm. You will be working with patients, so must be empathetic.
Interview Questions: Regular questions - nothing out of the norm.

title: New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, they have you submit references for a reference survey, schedule phone interview, phone interview with the units that are interested and it is conference style interview over the phone
Interview Questions: describing different times and experiences, strengths weaknesses etc.

title: Registered Nurse for the Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Over all this was a great interview. The hiring managers and nurses were extremely kind and I could tell that they loved their jobs. There was a panel of multiple nurses asking me questions. They all were enthusiastic and answered all my questions about the nurse residency program very well.
Interview Questions: If you could choose a career other than nursing, what would you choose?

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCHealth in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Because I live out of state they did my interview over the phone. Asked me to describe nursing experience,  describe myself.  Asked about conflict with someone at work, doctor, coworker, manager,  etc and how I handled it. Asked about a time I had to handle difficult patient or family member.  Asked how I advocated for my patient. Asked what type of patient I prefer not to take care of, or what makes them hard. My goals in next 3 years. What type of management team do I need to flourish.
Interview Questions: Describe a time I had conflict with someone at work. What was situation? With whom? Why? And how was it handled?

title: LCSW Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Waited about 3 weeks after application before getting a call. waited another 2 weeks for an interview. was told a decision would be made by a certain date. did not hear back one way or the other. noted they were still interviewing, so I assumed that I am no longer in the running. would have been nice to at least get notification since I took time to attend interview, etc.
Interview Questions: describe certain scenarios, nothing too unusual

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview and then was called for a interview with two managers. Talked about all the options and benefits, PRN and FT positions.  Filled app online and got an email within a day, call a day later and was asked to fill out my references after my interview
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation or patient?

title: Chaplain Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Director of Spiritual Care Services, another educator, and a staff chaplain, who interviewed me for about a half hour.  The interview atmosphere was relaxed and felt informal. It was clear that they were looking for someone who can articulate their experience in a natural, integrated way, while being themselves.
Interview Questions: How has my ministry in a congregational setting shaped me for chaplaincy?

title: Senior Professional Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with the principal investigator and also had mini interviews with the main members of the lab to assure we would all get along. Also had a tour of the lab area.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: From the second I walked into the hospital, everyone was so kind and helpful. While waiting in the lobby for my interview to begin with a few other waiting candidates, the hiring recruiters there made us feel very comfortable and kept us updated about when we would be going back. I went back for my interview pretty quickly (I interviewed with oncology/BMT and pulmonary), but there were other units who were running a bit late on their interviews. When I went back for my interview, the interviewing team was so welcoming and kind, too. There was another interview going on in the same room, which threw me off a bit at first, but after getting into the groove of things, I didn't even notice it. The most stressful part of everything was interviewing with five people sitting across from me and five pairs of ears and eyes focusing on me. No matter how nice they were, it's still a bit stressful to have that many people judging you and your abilities. I would advise practicing answering questions with several people with you to better prepare for this, as I only practiced with one person.  The whole interview process took about an hour, and I was offered a position by e-mail less than a week later.
Interview Questions: What do you know about UChealth and the unit you're applying for?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Easy going, behavioral based questions. Asked to bring in the seven page application from applying but wasn't asked for. Panel type interviews from nurse manager(s) and/or charge nurse from unit
Interview Questions: What was an instance in the clinical setting where a patient was upset with you and how did you handle it?

title: Behavioral Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The actual interview was fine. The people I interviewed with were friendly and asked typical behavioral interview questions. 
I was given an offer for an entry level position, but because I had no prior experience (for an ENTRY LEVEL position) they decided to change the job title, drop the pay, and gave me TWO HOURS to make a decision. I have never heard of something like this. When I asked what the difference was between the new job title, the lady did not even know and I had to call someone else, who also did not fully know. It seemed like this new job title was the same as the one I interviewed for, but it was just a lower pay and worse hours. There was no clear outline of what exactly this job title was, and I was given two hours to accept or decline.  I just cannot believe how un-professional this was.
Interview Questions: How do you define boundaries?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Loveland, CO) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called a few days after submitting online. My first interview took place in front of a panel of five supervisors and managers. After the initial interview, I waited a week and was called back for a second. The next day I was informed of the results over the phone.
Interview Questions: Is your Advanced Practitioner title something Banner Health just made up?

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: The process was several interviews. It was a good oppertunity to meet the team and get a feel for the overall culture. I was asked to return for an interview for a more advanced position. I feel it was a good experience overall.
Interview Questions: Do you work better by yourself or in a team?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Typical generic questions, took weeks to get a call back, somewhat slow process depending on your start date. My start date was about a month out so they moved slow at times but I received my offer letter the day after my interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a co worker and how did you deal with it?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed from multiple floors, all very nice. Managers and assistant managers at the interview, total of about 8-10 people if I remember correctly. Questions very basic, strengths and weaknesses, etc. Would recommend applying for a job and accepting if given the opportunity.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you dealt with a conflict, and how did you handle that?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCHealth in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied in September and didn't hear back until October from the direct manager to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was fairly simple asking a little bit about your background and what you knew. I was able to get an in-person interview with the manager and two other lead techs. They started out with a quick tour around their lab which I noticed lots of techs pretty much standing around and talking to each other. It seemed like a very busy and crowded environment. For the interview, they each had questions already printed out on a form. I was to answer 20 questions along with extra technical questions. They did not acknowledge nor give feedback when I responded to their questions and you could feel that if you did not answer the technical questions right, you were pretty much out of consideration. One of the techs interviewing, pretty much expected me to get everything right when in reality no one's a walking encyclopedia. Once the interview was over, they said they would let me know if you are considered for a second interview. The next day I received a request for 5 references on Skill Survey where the references are sent an email to complete a 20 plus survey based on you.  I completed them all and had followed up with them. No answer and no rejection email. As a business, at least let the candidate know they are not considered. Even a generic email will do considering going through all the work especially with the references.
Interview Questions: What does Integrity mean to you?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Typical how would you handle questions’ sat in front on 4 people and they each asked questions. All personality base questions. Very short too. It took all day though due to the physical ability test and the interview as well. Physical ability is extremely easy for the average person
Interview Questions: A difficult situation and how did you deal with it

title: Intake and Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with 2 people, mostly asked basic interview questions and some personal/ conversational question. I had 2 interviews before I was offered this position. The second interview was with the lead doctor and his clinical staff and was more discussing the duties of the role in depth.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Travel RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with Manager via phone and she was very pleasant, explained the role, expectations, and different units I would work in as float pool RN. Only asked a few nursing questions.
Interview Questions: What information do you like to pass on in shift report

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line, then was asked to come in for an interview. After scheduling that, they sent me an e-mail asking for 5 references, 2 of which had to be supervisors. Further, those references had to use an online service individually to answer a 20+ question survey in order to be my reference. Whatever happened to a phone call? I did not feel comfortable asking my references to complete that, and so withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: When setting up the in-person interview over the phone they asked basic questions like when I want to work, why I want to work there, that sort of thing.

title: Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, quick phone call, then they brought me in. I live an hour and a half away, so they put me in a hotel for the night - which I still didn't get reimbursed for. Oh, and I just never heard back. They said they'll follow up in a few days, then ghosted me. 

Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Name your experience with SDLC

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions:
1.  30 Minute telephone phone screen with hiring manager.
2.  One-hour group panel interview with team of six.  I had to present a 10 minute powerpoint  presentation of a project I worked on.  I spent many hours preparing.
3.  One-hour interview with the hiring manager and had to present the same 10 minute powerpoint presentation. 
I was asked to have 5 previous supervisors and peers submit long detailed references with twenty questions rating my performances on a scale of 1-7 (I had to submit their information and have them complete the questions within a 48 hour window).

I never received a response either way.
All that work, wasting my time and the time of my valuable references.   As a professional, the reference step is the most upsetting.  How many times is it acceptable to ask people to fill out long reference questionnaires immediately?  I just wasted one of those favors for nothing.

This experience was unprofessional and very disrespectful.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict and how did you handle it?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Three different meetings, one with director, then met entire team and allowed them to ask questions of me in a conference room, then met with CMO. I was made an offer and countered, which counter offer was accepted
Interview Questions: What is your take on Education for team members

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume with an employee referral. Seems like the only way to get into UCH is to know someone on the inside. Came in for an interview two days later, met with the RN Floor Manager, interviewed, and was told I'd hear something in two days since she had three other people to interview. Got a call not even 20 minutes after I left for a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with the usual questions regarding customer service, face to face interview asking for examples of experience dealing with patients.
Quite laid lack, only one person interview.
Invited for a 'working interview' a week later. Basically sat next to staff and watched them work.
Was slightly disappointed that the interviewer said they would contact... Waited 3 weeks and got a generic email saying someone else was hired. But this seems to be the standard for most companies nowadays.
Interview Questions: Generic 'give examples of' questions

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Very formal. A board room full of people each with prescripted questions. Not conversational. But mostly standard questions (challenges, weaknesses, strenghens, etc.) Super nice folks just following a system I believe
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: ACP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Sent an applications and was contacted by Paul Lavine, a recruiter, to schedule an interview. About 15 minutes,  in front of 3 nurse managers from two different units that I applied for. They had a paper of questions front and back and would write down my answers.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Advanced Care Partner Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Pannel interview with several departments who were interested in your application. It was a full day of applicants scheduled at different times, so the waiting area was a bit tense. The whole application and interview process was facilitated by a very nice guy (Paul L.), who help ease the nerves. Before the interview day Paul had sent out a document that had listed on it the date and time of everyones interview, along with the departments who will be present at your interview.
Interview Questions: Q: "In a clinical setting, you have two call lights going off, the 1600 vital signs are due to be done, one pt needs a blood glucose level check, and a code alarm is going off. Which to you attend to first? Which would you check second?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCHealth in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted a week or two later by a charge nurse to set up an interview. My interview took place with two charge nurses and the nurse manager. They were all very welcoming and friendly and gave me a tour of the unit afterwards.
Interview Questions:
Strengths/weaknesses
Behavioral and situation based questions. The whole interview took 15-20 minutes with pretty typical interview questions

title: Project Manager, Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Acronym rich interview.  For an external candidate, the questions are seemingly riddled with unknown internal standards and guidelines. This can be problematic considering organizations use "key terms" or descriptions of "providers" differently. There can be a missed opportunity due to communication or lack thereof.
Interview Questions:
The interviewer gives you a spreadsheet with a likely scenario. 
You have 10 minutes to decide which vendor to choose for an onboarding clinic process for blood serum services.

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The nurse recruiter first introduced herself, and explained what was going to happen for the day. First went into a room with 3 nurse educators who asked me to tell them a little bit about myself and then they explained what the program was like and gave me a chance to ask questions. There was then a 10 minute interview in a separate room with 8 people, different nurses representing each floor/unit available for offers. I then went into a 30 minute interview with the Cardiac floor separately with 4 people. Overall, a really great process and won't be notified about offers for another 2 weeks. I liked that they were very clear about the entire process, and gave me a time frame on when to hear back from people.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you do to intentionally connect with your patients.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was organized and efficient. The recruiter getted myself and others who had scheduled interviews and they also had the option to schedule a hospital tour. I sat before a panel of 3 nurse leaders from the specified unit that I was interviewing with and they were all super friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: How would you describe patient experience?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved a phone screen and an on site interview.  The interview was initially scheduled for July but in the leading days up to the interview they cut all communication and would not respond to a simple email or voicemail.  Two weeks after the initial interview date, they reached out and asked to reschedule the interview for early August.  After being interviewed on site they again went completely dark on me and neglected, or refused, to return any emails or phone calls regarding my status as an applicant.   Of all the organizations I interviewed with, the UCH Strategy and Planning department was the least professional in their handling of the hiring process.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging experience you have faced in your time at college or at work?

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Fort Collins, CO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
A group of four nurses performed the interview. They asked the standard set of questions and some other harder questions. What was the most difficult was they gave me what was basically four small case studies and asked what I would do in each situation. I get that this is a new grad position, but it seemed a little excessive.
Toward the end, I got to ask questions and they seemed to brush them off and kind of beat around the bush as far as their answers. Additionally, I was not offered a tour of the unit, which I have been offered in every other interview I have had at hospitals. I was honestly relieved when I did not get offered the job. Dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Who is your "nurse" role model?

title: Environmental Services Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCHealth (Loveland, CO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: A lot of the interview was based on what was on my resume. I was a graduated high school student, so I did not contain much work experience. However, it was very straight forward.
Interview Questions: Why Environmental Services?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email on when my interview was scheduled. There was no choice on when your interview was. The interview was behavior based questions with a panel of nurse leaders from the units interested in hiring you.
Interview Questions: How would you describe "patient experience"?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a short interview, fairly typical but important questions. I interviewed with the manager of the department and the educator; they were informative and friendly. UCHealth does require 5 references after the interview, so be prepared for that.
Interview Questions: What do you think your job description as a CNA is? What kind of things would you report to the nurse?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the manager and she was extremely friendly and professional. Made a very inviting atmosphere. When HR called to offer the position the pay was dramatically lower than working as a nurse on the floor and I sadly had to decline the position due to financial reasons. It seems like a lovely place to work.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing process was fine.  Onboarding process was a mess.  Horrible confusion - emails from my recruiter but he didn't know why I was being deferred.  I had quit my job, got deferred and then went 2 weeks without income.  Was hard as I'm a single mom.
Interview Questions: How do you handle an irate patient

title: ACP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the leaders from every department and they asked me a bunch of questions. The first one and I could tell this was a huge test question was what do you know about UCHealth, so do your research.
Interview Questions: What do you know about UCHealth

title: Applications Developer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Worked through a couple of programming problems on a white board. Diagrammed some work I had done on database design at my previous position. The entire department came in at the end to ask me questions.
Interview Questions: Write a function to tell if a string is a palindrome.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCHealth in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Everyone at UCH was really passionate about healthcare and excited to interview the potential interns. I had a very positive experience. They asked fairly difficult behavioral questions and situational questions about healthcare. There was a phone interview and skype interview.
Interview Questions: Choose one word you would like a peer to use to describe you and why.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
One of the hiring managers called me over the phone and we talked for 10 minutes and she decided to bring me in for a more formal interview. 
The interview was a bit off and right off the bat, you could feel the tension in the room. The hiring manager and another manager were in the interview together. They asked the usual behavioral questions. 
When I asked them a question they didn't answer the same way I did. I asked "what's the culture like ?" Their response "it's great!" That's it.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to deal with an upset patient and what was the outcome?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel review with about 5-6 people and everyone asked questions.  It was comprised of fellow assistants, doctors and directors.  After passing the panel review, there was individual reviews with each person I was working for and the directly in charge of the my position. They were all very responsive during the interview and contacted me in a timely fashion between interviews to let me know how I did and what would happen next.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?

title: Business Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: My Supervisor requested that I apply for the position. It did take several months after I interviewed to find that I had the job.  I was interviewed by a board of 6 people.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength and your greatest weakness

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Started with an initial phone call, which ultimately led to an in person interview a few days later. Was taken back to meet with the clinic manager as well as another manager, asked brief but defining questions. The interview in its entirety lasted about 15 minutes, and I was able to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for UCHealth?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: normal process, meaning: call from human resources, email from recruiter with interview date. interview with unit director and manager. offer submitted within one week, and accepted. great unit atmosphere, competent staff, competitive pay
Interview Questions: why am I a nurse

title: Billing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I walk in one day and ask if they were hiring they said yes I left my resume with front office receptionist. Three days Iater i had a interview. One of the doctors called me and the other interviewed me. It was a short and easy process it was comfortable but to straight and direct.
Interview Questions: Do you know medical terminology and how to spell?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Fort Collins, CO) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called me  about a week after I applied online. I came in for an in person interview. They asked typical questions. They called a week or 2 later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: How do you exemplify the companies values?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Came to unit I was interviewing on and I was greeted by Unit Secretary. I waited for the manager in the waiting area. When I met the manager I was ushered into a room with 4 other managers and the interview began. Several other managers came in and out during my interview. After the interview, I was given a tour of the unit (upon my request) and then I was show to the elevators. I received an offer from HR the next day.
Interview Questions: What's a mistake you have made in your nursing practice?

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email from a manager to set up a time for an interview. Showed up early for the interview and met with an awkward hiring manager , who talked through his teeth the whole time. The whole short 15 minute interview was hostile and unexpected. It was apparently just a screening where the hiring manager grilled me about my BA in Public health and why I didn't choose to go on a more clinical path. I found the whole interview to be weird especially since the position  didn't require a BA degree.  After 15 minutes of awful small talk he informed me that this was just the beginning of the process and I would hear back via email. Three weeks later I received a generic rejection email. I don't think I will be applying  for any other positions. After speaking with others it seems they have a hostile interview style that doesn't mesh well with my personality. Also ,on a side note , the manger went on and on about a family atmosphere, but I got the feeling that if you were different or didn't fit into the current environment , they wouldn't be hiring you. I am personally not a fan of mixing my personal life with my work life.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? How would your classmates describe you? How big are your classes? 

AKA nothing about the job itself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Assistant Manager and the Clinical Educator for the unit. I traveled from out of town and they were very accommodating with my schedule and allowing me to pick a specific interview date and time. They were very welcoming and friendly and asked a lot of good questions on the interview. I was also given a tour of the unit and met some of the nurses on the floor as well.
Interview Questions: What are some things that you struggle with as a nurse?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  Then, I was contacted by a recruiter who arranged an interview with the hiring manager.  I was out of state, so I had a phone interview with the hiring manager.  The next day, I was contacted by the recruiter with a job offer.
Interview Questions: What is my greatest strength?

title: HIPAA Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Loveland, CO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview consisting of the Hiring Manager, Team Lead, and a HIPAA specialist.  Each asked a series of fairly basic interview questions as well as some questions specific to the position.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have with release of information?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received a call to do an over the phone interview, which led to an in-person panel interview with 3 different departments. First, went over my resume and then continued on with all the basic interview questions. Make sure you bring plenty of copies of your resume to pass around.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle a difficult customer
Why do you want to work here?
Have you ever dealt with a difficult co-worker?

title: Patient Access Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy. I interviewed with 3 members of the team: manager of Patient Registration and two team leads of the the teams the manager overseas. The manager began with an overview of the position, added new information that was not included in the job announcement, went over the duty hours, the location, and work setting. The questions were pretty common: How do you handle conflict? What is the most stressful situation you had to deal with at work and how did you handle it?, etc.  They were very upfront with the number of candidates they were interviewing for the position and let me know they would contact me via e-mail with job offer or rejection within the next couple of days. I received a "sorry we went with another candidate" e-mail a week and 1 day after the interview.
Interview Questions: What does patient experience mean to you?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO)
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly welcoming interview.  Hire based on whether you are a good fit for the position as opposed to years of experience.  
A charge nurse and the floor manager interviewed together.  Then manager showed you the floor.  
Got the job within 48hrs.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation that you encountered and how did you handle it.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. One with the hiring mgr and a second with a team of managers from the dept. one one one interview was about 40 minutes but the panel interview took about 2 hours. People would call in and ask their questions then drop off.
Interview Questions: What is a primary key?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Phone followed by In person meeting followed by team meeting.  Then waited for hr to call with an offer.  All contingent on background and drug testing.  There was a test on personality and skills
Interview Questions: What was your most fun project to work on

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by one the supervisors, was given a tour of the department, sat in a conference room and was asked several behavioral questions, was given the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: On your last review, what was one of the items you were going to work on for the upcoming year?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job. A few weeks later I was called by a recruiter asking for days and times I was available for an interview with her.  She never called me on those dates and times and withdrew me from consideration for the jobs.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Department manager called. 45 minute telephone interview. Led to over two hours face-to-face. An hoir with the msnager and another hour with the team. Serious consideration about an offer being given was made evident by the hiring manager and that HR would get back to me in 2 business days max to extend the decision. This never occurred. 4 out of 5 required references were given prior to interview and 5th reference gave her reference 5 business days after the interview. A total of 6 references given and the waiting game continued. By day 17, no email and no call. A quick check on the HR system, no job offer. A HUGE waste of time which is unfortunate because the team was nice. 5 references is overkill but whatever. I gave them 6.
Interview Questions: Are you looking to do your own research?

title: ACP Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an email correspondence, then interview with HR, then interview with 3-7 members of the unit you're applying for.  I ended up on the neuro floor when I wanted ICU, they hand you off to other floors if they like you enough but not enough to keep themselves. I was disappointed, the interview went really well and I got a totally different floor. The whole diversity bit they love, but they don't employ diverse people, or people with opinions. They just want mindless workers that will be willing to stick it out for the long haul. Make sure you say you are dedicated and hardworking, and have stories for each positive and negative quality (if it's negative, make sure you then say how you overcame it and how you're working on being a better person).
Interview Questions: How did you overcome a stressful time?

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Online application. Brief phone screen via recruiters. Phone call for invitation. 1 hour interview consisting of program director, Clinical Specialists and Clinical Pharmacists. Call back within 20 days.
The environment was very friendly with the Director meeting me in the lobby and walking me out, taking this time to ask some non-formal, but important questions. 
Overall it was a very smooth process.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions to assess your 'fit' for the department. The interview panel did a great job reviewing my CV and asking questions pertaining to my experience and how I could benefit the department and how the department could benefit me.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCHealth (Littleton, CO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Jackie was through no nonsense type women she had called the school and I was highly recommended so it was like I had job already when I arrived she was telling me about position benifits etc rather then asking questions
Interview Questions: Does this sound like a good fit for you?

title: RDCS Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCHealth in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: meet and greet, questions, role play, job responsibilities, on call, shift work, tour of facility, explanation of benefits,  show locker room, review application, meet charge personnel, answer basic  and standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this situation?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: When I applied, a recruiting person emailed me 2 weeks later asking me to complete a brief phone interview. When she called she asked questions like "What made you choose this company? What do you look for in a job?" I think it was really just to gauge the person's interest, then she said she would pass my resume along to the hiring manager and they would contact me at a later date for either another interview or if they were not pursuing me further.
Interview Questions: What do you typically look for in a job?

title: Program Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from a recruiter maybe 2-3 weeks after applying on University of Colorado Health's job site. The recruiter asked me questions about my where I saw myself in the future maybe five years from then and my career aspirations. The recruiter then asked me to fill out a reference survey with five references. It took about three business days for them to email me asking me to call them to schedule an interview. The interview consisted of two employees and were all typical behavioral interview questions. The interview only lasted about half an hour.
Interview Questions:
Name a skill you do better than others, one you are about average in and another you need to work on.

Have you handled a difficult situation with a co-worker? How?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick, efficient.  Phone interview with admin. team, department vice chair and department chair and staff I'd be supporting.  On every level/ step of interview process, I was made to feel comfortable.  Some questions were typical.  I liked how they made me feel during the interview process.  It was like a conversation, get to know each other type of interview.
Interview Questions: Some questions were typical.  Skill set, why I wanted the job, describe certain situations and how I handled them.

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group panel interview about 6 employees in department taking teens asking questions.  Most of the questions situational.  "In the past how have you handled a difficult patient "asked several questions then asked if I had questions.  Then I was called in to experience the job and basically be interviewed by a person with the same job in the department.  I was an internal applicant so i had additional steps to transfer and was forced to basically leave 2 months notice with my current department at the time.
Interview Questions: How would you handle down time?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UCHealth
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in April.  HR called for first interview in June.  Second interview with clinical manager was set up for 2 weeks after.  Received call for third interview another 2 weeks after that.  Received job offer over the phone from HR and started in August.
Interview Questions:
Situation questions: Please describe a time when you had to use team work. Please describe a time when you were unsure of what you were doing and what steps you took.  
They also had quite a few chain of command questions: Another nurse wants you to break protocol to administer some medications, what do you do?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Fort Collins, CO) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application process, called for interview by manager, interviewed following week with panel of 6 current managers. Placed at head of the table, 20+ questions and scenarios for over an hour, challenging but not impossible if prepared. Temp of room 10-15 degrees warmer than needed, everyone had refreshments, none offered to me. Possibly to see if they could make the interviewee uncomfortable?
Interview Questions: All expected, no surprises...and all challenging when it's one after another. Grueling interview process, UN-neccessarily so.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UCHealth in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: People are treated like objects they can use and discharge
Interview Questions: Waste of time, they already knew who they were going to hire, they just use people for their benefit.

title: Nutrition Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They have you do a group interview and sell some products.  They are looking to see how you are as team player and social skills. If they like you they will have you interview with a supervisor.  It's pretty basic.
Interview Questions: How do you respond in a stressful situation.

title: Care Team Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UCHealth in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was hired by word of mouth. I e-mailed an application to the doctor I was friends with she gave it to my now boss and they called me a few days later for and interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this job?

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: You go through two rounds. Its through a search committee, about 4-6 persons.  If you make it through the first round, they recommend you to the second. You stand a better chance if more than half of the committee like you and find you fit. Start days are usually the 1st or the 15th of the month. If you are used to biweekly pay, get ready to make some adjustments, as you will have to wait until end of the month to get paid. They definitely reach out to your references, if you list someone down, make sure they are legit and can truly give accurate information.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, why are you interested in the job, strengths and weakness - very cooperate like.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCHealth (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 3 women for a registrar postion. The interview questions were way over the top and I did not even understand half of them. I have 8 years of experience in the medical industry and it don't take much knowledge to be a registrar.
Interview Questions: What type of programs do you work on give an example from the beginning to end, it was something like that. The questions were technical and had nothing to do with registration. Another question was name a time when you had to help a coworker.

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a new grad interview several years ago. It was very professional.   There were 5 people that interviewed me in a round robin fasion.   They asked various questions ranging from experience to when I made a mistake in the past. I talked about my past expereince in ortho and my brothers accident.
Interview Questions: When was the time you made a mistake

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Fort Collins, CO) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty normal laid back interview. Wasn't difficult or overly stressful. They kept in contact throughout the process and I always knew what was expected. I felt at ease with the people who interviewed me and they did a great job answering my questions.
Interview Questions: If I was bilingual and how I'd handle very difficult people.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCHealth in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: After initial telephone screening, had an "audition" with two other candidates in the room. Was asked to present a brief lecture on a technical topic. Took several weeks between interview and job offer, with little communication in spite of efforts to follow up.
Interview Questions: What adjective has someone used to describe you that came as a surprise?

title: Flex B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a one-on-one phone interview with a unit manager. I had applied a month or two before getting the call. The interview was straight forward. A few personality questions, asking how I deal with conflict, how I manage difficult situations, clinical experience, and a few clinical questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict? What type of patients do you have experience with?

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Denver, CO) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed, and then participated in interviews for other team members in the following few years.  You need to have a good clinical and IT background. You need to have experience working with providers and have good personal skills.  You need to be good at troubleshooting.  You need to be good at answering tough questions, both in the interview and on the job.
Interview Questions: What is more important: data integrity or customer service.

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCHealth (Loveland, CO) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: None experienced applicants are hired before interdepartmental employees are given the job. Always have openings in this department since they lose employees every month due to transfers or quitting. Many new hires have no experience and that possibly is what management wants so you can be overworked beyond your job description and you wouldn't know any better.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are a great fit for this job?

title: Director of IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It started with one hour phone interview with the HR Director and then a video interview with the hiring manager. They had me fly over for a 2 days interview.
Interview Questions: How would you have business units to buy into your ideas?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Fort Collins, CO) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very well thought through interview where both parties asked many questions, technical and otherwise and both agreed that I would be well suited for the position.  Everyone was willing to explain the details of the job and available to answer in questions I may have had during and after the interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about Active Directory

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UCHealth (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Must have an excellent resume and it was a drawn out process. They have an interview board. This is many managers that interview throughout the year. Five will be asked to interview on a specific day. Eventhough it might not even be the manager for the position you are applying for.
Interview Questions: What can you offer to the facility.
